Author: ced
Content: Yep. Written conversations lack the live, non-verbal feedback that one gets face to face, so it makes sense to spend more time thinking about it to make sure that you convey what you want. I also prefer meeting people in person. It makes stronger relationships.

Author: vlad
Content:
You can test your web site in all web browsers, operating systems, resolutions, flash, java activex, full screen or not.

A similar service is www.browsercam.com, which charges 19.95 per day up to $1,000 a year.

Author: vlad
Content: No problem!  I've seen some web sites that charged hundreds of dollars a month, or by the hour.

Content: Why not?  I voted you up to 2 to cheer you up.  That was the title of the blog post where I found the link, so I just instinctively wrote that.

Author: danielha
Content: TechCrunch does not have anywhere near that number of average visitors per day, FYI.

Author: nandan
Content:
What you say is true. However, my reference to Wikipedia's view on NLP by no means meant anything conclusive or dismissive. Given Wikipedia's social aspect, it was just another way of validating that others too shared my deep suspicion of and disillusionment with yet another self-help system.

Surely you have felt this frustration while having to deal with these books/systems yourself?

Author: ecuzzillo
Content: If this had the same title, but without the FREE at the end, I probably would have clicked on it. It kind of goes without saying that most things on the internet, particularly random technical services like this, are free.
